result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharon K. Ekornaas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sharon K. Ekornaas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sharon K. Ekornaas was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharon K. Ekornaas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Joe Easton.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:04pm-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  Amended information filed.  DE acknowledges receipt & waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed.  Court orders a $250.00 fine plus costs & drug surcharge, due in 30 days or civil judgment.  NO DNA SURCHARGE.  Appeal rights given.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Joseph Easton.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  State failed to subpoeana officers for today's evidentiary hearing.  Hearing reset for 5/21/15 at 1:30 (2 hours) over the objection of Atty Easton.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Sharon K. Ekornaas, appeared with Attorney Joe Easton.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Discussion held. Matter set for an evidentiary hearing.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
filed by Attorney Joseph Easton

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No drug paraphernalia  *No Contact w/ Jack D or his residence.
961.41(1)(h)2 - Man/Del THC 961.41(3g)(e) - Poss of THC  961.573(1) - Poss of drug paraph

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Joseph Easton.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:46am-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  Co-DE Anderson's counsel (Attorney Kmiec) advises the court that the defense attorneys are requesting an evidentiary hearing.  Discussion held.  Court will not set an evidentiary hearing at this time unless there is additional information.  If there is additional information, Court requests it be put in writing by motion - DE to file motion by 1/12/2015;  State to respond by 2/12/2015;  DE to reply by 2/20/2015.  DE's motion for bond modification.  State takes no position.  Court modifies bond - DE may have contact with Timothy A.  All others conditions remain.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.
for Modification of Bond - filed by Attorney Joseph Easton    (12/12/2014 at 9:30am)
Final pre-trial on December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Cumberland), 10/28/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 12/12/2014 at 9:30am.  NTBS by the Court.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Supress - filed by ADA Jason Zapf
to Suppress - filed by Attorney Joseph Easton

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Joseph Easton.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:45pm-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  DE is prepared to file a motion to suppress.  Discussion held re: the contents of the motion.  For reasons set forth on the record, Court adjourns matter to October 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-1-14 @ 2:30pm. Bond continued.
